articles.title: GPS of the Brain: Marmoset Gaze Reveals New Insights into Spatial Navigation - Neuroscience News
articles.description: On a cellular level, the marmoset's hippocampal regions show selectivity for 3D view and head direction, suggesting that gaze, not place, is key to their spatial navigation.
articles.content:
Summary: Researchers have discovered that the common marmoset, a diurnal primate, navigates its surroundings differently from previously studied rats, reflecting its unique ecological adaptations.
